modules.description: This module exposes performance monitoring counters from the Linux `perf` API, including metrics like CPU cycles, instructions executed, cache misses, branch mispredictions, and context switches. It works with `Mperf.t` values to measure and report low-level system performance events during program execution. Use it to profile application performance on Linux systems where `perf` is available, such as measuring cache efficiency or CPU utilization in performance-critical code.

This module exposes low-level performance counters from the Linux `perf` API, such as CPU cycles, instructions executed, cache misses, and context switches. It works directly with `Bechamel.Measure.witness` to capture and report hardware and software event metrics during benchmarking. Use it to measure and compare the performance of OCaml code sections with high precision on Linux systems.

This module provides access to Linux `perf` API counters for measuring low-level system performance events such as CPU cycles, cache misses, and context switches. It uses `Mperf.t` and `Bechamel.Measure.witness` to capture and report metrics during program execution or benchmarking. You can use it to profile and compare the performance of OCaml code sections with high precision on Linux systems. For example, measure cache efficiency or CPU utilization in performance-critical functions.
